etymology.description: 串(串) (chuàn, "string together") + 串(串) (chuàn, "string together") refers to food items pierced and cooked on skewers.
etymology.interpretation: The repetition of 串(串) (chuàn, "string together") emphasizes the act of threading ingredients onto a skewer, which is common in street food culture where various meats and vegetables are skewered together and grilled.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃串串(我喜歡吃串串)。
冬天寒冷时(冬天寒冷時)，串串让人感觉温暖(串串讓人感覺溫暖)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān hánlěng shí, chuànchuàn ràng rén gǎnjué wēnnuǎn.
examples.english: When winter is cold, skewers make people feel warm.

examples.chinese: 夜市里(夜市裡)，各种美味的串串吸引顾客(各種美味的串串吸引顧客)。
examples.pinyin: Yèshì lǐ, gèzhǒng měiwèi de chuànchuàn xīyǐn gùkè.
examples.english: In the night market, various delicious skewers attract customers.
